terms.double-entry bookkeeping: accounting method where every transaction affects at least two accounts and debits equal credits
terms.trial balance: report showing all account balances to verify debits equal credits
terms.chart of accounts: organized list of all accounts used by an organization
terms.journal entry: complete transaction record with balanced debits and credits
terms.normal balance: whether an account type typically has debit or credit balance
terms.immutable audit trail: unchangeable record of all transactions and modifications
terms.running balance: continuously updated current balance maintained for performance
terms.posting: process of officially recording journal entry in ledger
terms.idempotency: property that operations can be safely repeated without changing result
terms.atomic transaction: database operation that either completes entirely or fails entirely
terms.reversal entry: offsetting journal entry that cancels out a previous entry without deletion
terms.validation pipeline: multi-stage process for checking entry correctness before posting
terms.point-in-time balance: historical balance calculation for specific date
terms.balance caching: performance optimization through materialized balance tables
terms.cache invalidation: removing stale cached values when underlying data changes
terms.optimistic locking: concurrency control using version numbers to detect conflicts
terms.balance engine: component responsible for efficient balance calculations
terms.append-only ledger: storage system that only allows adding new records, never modifying existing ones
terms.hash chain: cryptographic linking where each record includes hash of previous record
terms.change history tracking: complete audit log of who made what changes when with before/after values
terms.cryptographic integrity: tamper detection using hash chains and digital signatures
terms.audit report generation: compliance reports showing all entries and modifications for specified periods
terms.regulatory compliance: adherence to legal requirements for financial record keeping
terms.digital signature: cryptographic proof that data was created by authorized system
terms.content hash: fixed-size digest that uniquely identifies the content of a record
terms.integrity verification: process of checking that records haven't been tampered with
terms.balance sheet: point-in-time financial position showing assets equal to liabilities plus equity
terms.income statement: period-based profit and loss calculation from revenue and expense accounts
terms.multi-currency translation: converting foreign currency balances using appropriate exchange rates
terms.accounting period closing: process of finalizing transactions and transferring temporary account balances
terms.period activity: net change in account balance during reporting period
terms.translation adjustment: gain or loss from currency exchange rate changes
terms.closing entries: journal entries that transfer temporary account balances to permanent accounts
terms.circuit breaker: pattern that prevents cascading failures by temporarily rejecting requests
terms.two-phase commit: protocol ensuring atomic transactions across multiple resources
terms.read replica: read-only database copy for query load distribution
terms.leader election: process of selecting single instance for system-wide operations
terms.optimistic concurrency control: coordination using version numbers to detect conflicts
terms.compensation transaction patterns: reversal entries to undo partial multi-step operations
terms.point-in-time recovery: restoration to any previous consistent state
terms.exponential backoff: retry strategy with increasing delays between attempts
terms.balance consistency verification: comparing cached vs calculated balances for accuracy
terms.startup integrity verification: systematic check of critical systems before resuming operations
terms.fail-safe accounting integrity: system never allows unbalanced entries or inconsistent state
terms.property-based testing: testing approach using generated data to verify system invariants
terms.accounting invariant: mathematical relationship that must always hold true
terms.fixed-point arithmetic: exact decimal calculations without floating-point precision errors
terms.integration test: test verifying multiple components work together correctly
terms.unit test: test of individual component in isolation
terms.test oracle: mechanism for determining whether test results are correct
terms.balance discrepancy: when calculated account balances don't match expected values
terms.unbalanced entry: journal entry violating double-entry principle where debits don't equal credits
terms.audit trail integrity: assurance that all system changes are completely and accurately recorded
terms.systematic validation: comprehensive checking process following structured methodology
terms.root cause analysis: investigation technique to identify underlying problem source
terms.hash chain verification: cryptographic validation of audit record sequence integrity
terms.trial balance variance: difference between total debits and credits indicating ledger imbalance
terms.cache coherence: consistency between cached and database values
terms.concurrent access control: mechanisms preventing data corruption from simultaneous operations
terms.performance profiling: systematic measurement of system operation timing and resource usage
terms.forensic accounting: investigation techniques for financial data anomalies
terms.compensating entry: journal entry that corrects previous error while maintaining audit trail
terms.cash flow statement: financial report tracking actual money movements through operating, investing, and financing activities
terms.variance analysis: comparison of actual results against budgets or forecasts to identify performance differences
terms.custom report builder: user interface allowing non-technical users to create financial reports without coding
terms.multi-level approval processes: workflow requiring multiple authorization steps based on transaction amount or risk
terms.automated posting rules: business logic that automatically generates journal entries from recognized transaction patterns
terms.ERP integration: connection between ledger and enterprise resource planning systems for data synchronization
terms.bank feed integration: automated import and matching of bank statement transactions
terms.transaction matching: algorithmic process of correlating bank transactions with journal entries
terms.read replica distribution: scaling approach using read-only database copies to serve query workloads
terms.horizontal partitioning: data distribution strategy dividing ledger by entity or business unit
terms.distributed consensus: algorithm ensuring multiple nodes agree on transaction ordering and posting
terms.accounting invariants: fundamental rules that must never be violated regardless of system enhancements
terms.workflow engine: system managing multi-step approval processes with configurable business rules
terms.rule engine: component evaluating complex business conditions to determine approval requirements
terms.delegation management: capability to temporarily transfer approval authority between users
terms.data mapping: translation between different chart of accounts structures in system integration
terms.conflict resolution: handling simultaneous updates to same data across multiple systems
terms.transaction reconciliation: process of matching and verifying transactions between different systems
terms.event-driven architecture: design pattern where systems communicate through published events
terms.cache coherence protocols: mechanisms ensuring consistent cached data across multiple nodes
terms.data residency controls: compliance features ensuring data stays within required geographic boundaries
terms.configuration management: systematic approach to managing complex system settings and business rules
terms.temporal consistency: guarantee that related data changes are visible together at any point in time
terms.consolidation layer: system component combining financial data from multiple business entities
